1625319270_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac.body:
Tor has started the switch from V2 Onions to V3 Onions. They warned will in advance that at first, the decline would be slow - then very sudden. If you are using Tor (and you should) - there just is no telling how bad things will get. With the last update, many relays don't even speak V2 anymore. So they don't know how to handle your request.

Clearnet users should be unaffected.

1636134204_12rAw78P4EdKZWbBv2t3VYRFMiJEa.body:
There are no experts in this, excepting perhaps criminal elements which are likely making a killing in Australia right now. So that's probably what you need. A local criminal. One with access to private aviation.

Assuming you already have a passport - you just leave. Don't try to break any laws or kill anyone :) Authorities don't take kindly to that.

Make no mistake, this is risky tho. Criminals could take your money and dump you. Payment? Maybe half now, half on delivery via a cryptocurrency like Monero? If they knew with absolute certainty they would get nothing if they kidnapped you

Given what has leaked out of Australia - your effort will be very similar to escaping the Soviet Union (and you should treat it that way).

Goto some private airports. Try to work backward from there. Chances are you will find a drug smuggler.

Then write down your adventure and sell it to Hollywood. Escape from Australia :)

> [styromaniac@kxoid.bit](#comment_204_1PxcegJ1mKoMHeS73f9MvXeUWDq8BdnSv3): Hmm... Neither Blokada nor NextDNS block the test links, so you're probably less safe using them.

All of these DNS firewall schemes rely on user reports (usually delayed). They are mostly no different than antivirus products reliant on signatures...

Attackers are far more nimble than any such systems. Worse, legitimate users then tie themselves up in knots. Consider the capchas you've endured over time.

About the only success you'll ever get from blocking might be with the spies you purchase and install into your home. Like smart TVs, or many devices using web based control panels (really in the cloud). Even then - you just annoy them. Those weasels will find a way.

Great joy. Especially if it later leaks that all their attacks can be proved. Followed by a special day when all are found dead.

Hackers should die. All of them.
